title: Clinton Training Race
description: The Clinton Training Race is a training race open to all USAC licensed racers. There will be three self selecting categories to choose from. "A" - Elite and experienced men and women. "B" - Recommended for competitive racers with some racing experience. "C" Recommended for racers with little to no racing experience. We may have an experienced "race Mentor" join this group to provide in race guidance
course: The Clinton Loop is a mostly flat course with a dew short rises.The circuit is about 6.5 miles in length
registration: Registration will take place at Missoula Bicycle Works - 708 So. Higgins Ave. Registration opens at 9:00am and closes at 11:00am
directions: Event parking and race start is located about 18 miles east of Missoula in the town of Clinton. Take the Clinton Exit, turn right. You will see the parking area on your right hand side

title: Drummond Training Race
description:
Drummond Training Race

Run as a handicapped race.  C level riders, usually Cat 4 & 5 Men and women and Juniros start.  Followed in 7 minutes by the B level rider, usually Cat 3 & 4 Men and better Women Racers.  Fourteen minutes after the C racers, the remaining racers take out in pursuit.  First one across the finish line wins, regardless of the field you started with.

There will be some higher category riders with the C field to provide mentoring and strategy assistance during the race.  Once or If the A field catches the C racers, the mentors will be free to race with the fastest racers and compete for the finish.
course: Course starts in the campground on the south side of the Clark Fork river in Drummond.  There will be a neutral start to the race start area.  All field will leave the campground together.  The course will proceed East on the frontage road for 13.2 miles to the end of the pavement, just past the Gold Creek interstate intersection.  During the return to Drummond along the same route, the fields will turn North toward Helmsville (Hwy 271) for 6 miles to the top of the pass, turnaround and make a right turn at the bottom for the final 1.25 miles to the finish, just prior to the town.
registration: On-line regsutration is preferred.  Licenses can be both on-site through the USA Cycling website ($70).  One-day beginner licenses can be purchased on site for $15.
notes: There will be limited support.  I suggest a tube and pump.  The course is in good shape.  If there is ice on the climb toward Helmville the race will be shortened.
directions: Coming to Drummond on I90 from the West, take exit 153, enter town and take the only right over RR tracks toward the campground, about .25 miles.  Coming to Drummond from the East, take exit 154, enter town and take the left over the RR tracks about halfway through town.

address.street: Helena BLM Scratchgravels District, Echo Dr. TH

This is an enduro style race.  
Check us out at montanaenduro.com

334 Jackson Street
Helena, MT

title: Herron Hammer
description: A mix of flowy singletrack, some technical singletrack with small rock drop, and some double track.
course:
One to four laps on a 6.4 mile course with 1000' of climbing
70% singletrack
registration:
Register on line by 5/15/2015 for $20.00
Day of registration: $25.00
USAC license required
One Day license available for $10.00
Juniors race for free
directions: From US 93 south of Kalispell take Rocky Cliff Dr. west for 1.2 mi.  Turn left onto Airport Rd.  Take Airport Rd. for 1.5 mi continue onto Foys Canyon Rd for 2.3 mi.  Turn left onto Foys lake road where you will see the parking lot on your left.

title: MT Alpha Cycling MTB Skills Clinic
description:
Third annual mountain bike skills clinic in the Rattlesnake. Once again we will have a great group of instructors leading skills work in the morning and group rides in the afternoon. Groups include 2 instructors and 8 participants, and is open to all skill levels. 

New this year, the only cost for the skills clinic is the USA Cycling one day license. But to sign up for the clinic, you have to be a member of the MT Alpha Club team. Our goal is continue to grow mountain biking in our community and get more ladies on the trails. Please see our website for more information: www.mtalphacycling.org

We look forward to seeing you in May!
registration: To take part in the clinic, you have to be a club member of MT Alpha. This can be done from our website. Registration for the skills clinic opens on April 15 from our website: www.mtalphacycling.org
directions:
Ten Spoon Vineyard + Winery
4175 Rattlesnake Dr, Missoula, Montana 59802

title: Monday Night Lights: Billings Criterium Series
description: Welcome to "Monday Night Lights Criterium Series" benefiting the Downtown Billings Associations' Spare Change for Real Change fund to end homelessness, Young Life, and IC3 MT.  The first race in the series was the "Purple Crit" downtown under Skypoint.  The final three races (on June 8th, 15th, and 22nd) will be held at South Park in Billings, MT.  South Park is located off of South Broadway and 6th Avenue South."
course: The course is fast and flat with four left turns all around South Park in Billings, MT.  The laps are approximately .7 mile laps that surround the course so there will be great spectator action for sure.  Each race will have at least 2 preme laps."
registration: Pre-register online for only $20 (online registration closes on Thursday evening) or register on site the day of the event for $30.  ALL HEATS REGISTRATIONS ARE CLOSED @ 7:00 p.m. race day UNLESS you make prior arrangements with the race director, Coul Hill (406-690-6629 or CoulHill@gmail.com
notes: Race will be held RAIN or SHINE. JUNIORS AND KIDS RACE FREE. This will be a closed course, no traffic. Cash payouts are as follows: Pro/1/2/3 =75/50/25 Masters = 60/40/20 Cat 4/5 = 50/30/20 ***Womens cash payout will be dependent upon field size*** ***Cash payouts may be lowered if the registrations are not enough to cover the payout*** ***Promoter reserves the right to combine and/or separate fields*** No refunds. Junior = Racers under 18 on 12/31/15. Kids = Racers under 10 on 12/31/15. Senior = Any racer over 18 years old. Master = Racers over 35 years old who prefer to race in the Masters category. ***Masters categories will be divided into 35+/45+/55+ categories for awards if the field size is greater than 20***
directions: From 27th Street in Billings, turn west on 6th Avenue South and the park will be on your left.  Registration will be under the orange IC3 tent."

title: Zootown Eliminator
description: Invitational Eliminator at Caras Park.
course: Technical, spectator friendly, urban course at Caras Park.
registration: Invited riders will be able to register on site.
notes: Prize: $250 men, $250 women. Winner take all!

title: Missoula XC presented by Zillastate
description: The Missoula XC presented by Zillastate began in 2011 as a community run event. It continues in its fifth year at Marshall Mountain and has expanded to include an Eliminator and Enduro race.
course: We heard once that idle hands to the Devil’s work. Well that makes sense, because I don’t remember having much to do back in the summer of aught-ten, and we’ve heard more than a few people describe the climbing on this course as “pure evil.” The 5 km trail was purpose built for UCI sanctioned, World Cup style cross country mountain bike racing, and we like to think of it as a little bit of a throwback to when mountain bike racing was mountain bike racing. We’ve got steep climbs, flowing bermed corners, and even the chance to hang it out a little bit on a gap jump for those so inclined.
registration: Race day registration closes 30 minutes before the start of each race. Packet pickup is available at the Caffe Dolce Block Party on Friday evening.
directions: Located at Marshall Mountain 7 miles from downtown Missoula. From the Van Buren I90 exit take East Broadway towards East Missoula. East Broadway is also called Highway 200. Follow East Broadway/Hwy 200 for roughly 3.6 miles. Turn left onto Marshall Canyon Road (There will be a Marshall Resort Sign). Take Marshall Canyon Road for 2.7 miles. Parking is in the lot before the gate or along the road. Race Headquarters and packet pick up are at the lodge.

title: Discovery XC
description: The race will is part of the Montana Off-Road Series (MORS) state championship series. The race will be held at Discovery Ski Area on Sunday June 21, 2015.  The race will begin at 11:00 am.
course: The race and registration will be located at Discovery Ski Area. The course is a 7.3-mile loop comprised of 60% double-track and 40% single-track.
registration: On-line registration is $30 and on-site registration will be available from 9:00 AM – 10:30 AM at Discovery Ski Area.  The cost for on-site registration is $40.
notes:
All USAC Rules Apply
Juniors racing in junior category – free, those racing their categories $30
Promoters reserve the right to combine classes
directions:
Directions to Discovery Ski Area
From the east:
Take Interstate 90 to exit 208 onto Highway 1 west towards Anaconda (8 miles). Continue west on Highway 1 for 20-miles to Georgetown Lake. Turn right (north) at the Discovery Ski Area and St. Timothy's Chapel signs. Continue north for 4.5-miles to the ski area.
From the west:
Take Interstate 90 to exit 153 onto Highway 1 east towards Philipsburg (26 miles). Remain on Highway 1 past Philipsburg towards Georgetown Lake. Two miles past the Georgetown Lake dam turn left (north) at the Discovery Ski Area and St. Timothy's Chapel signs. Continue north for 4.5-miles to the ski area..

title: Montana Enduro Series #2-Hair of the Dog
description: Enduro Style Race
course:
Multiple timed and un-timed sections, total of combined downhill time will determine total time.  Sportident timing for instant results.  
Route will be announced the Wednesday before the event, see montanaenduro.com for further details
registration: Online preregistration through USA Cycling.  June 20-21st registration on site if space is still available.  Make sure your year license is renewed on USAC website prior to event, day licenses available online as well.
notes:
Saturday evening registration at 5250 Marshall Canyon Rd., Missoula, MT 59802 at Missoula XC after party.
Sunday morning onsite registration and race start at 5000 Blue Mountain Rd, Missoula, MT 59804. Registration starting at 7:30, closes 1 hour before start for each category.  
Racer meeting 30 mintues before start for each category. 
Race starts at 11AM for Pro/Cat 1 and 9AM for Cat 2/3
directions: 5000 Blue Mountain Rd, Missoula, MT 59804.

title: Celebrate Freedom Criterium Race
description: The State Championship Criterium Race is a benefit to the Disabled American Veterans organization.
course: The course is a 1.3 mile loop around Harvest Church in Billings.  The start and finish will be in the church parking lot.  The course will be partially closed (1 lane) and intersections will be controlled.  Cash prizes and state championship medals will be awarded.
registration: Register online at USACycling.org before 7/1 and the registration is only $25.  Registration increases to $35 after July 1st.
notes:
Race will be held RAIN or SHINE. 

JUNIORS AND KIDS RACE FREE. 

This will be a partially closed/open course, but traffic will be controlled. 

Cash payouts are as follows: 
Pro/1/2/3 =75/50/25. 
Masters = 60/40/20. 
Cat 4/5 = 50/30/20.
Citizens = 30/20/10 
***Womens cash payout will be dependent upon field size*** ***Cash payouts may be lowered if the registrations are not enough to cover the payout*** 

***Promoter reserves the right to combine and/or separate fields*** 

No refunds. 

Junior = Racers under 18 on race day. 
Kids = Racers under 10 on race day. 
Senior = Any racer over 18 years old. 
Master = Racers over 35 years old who prefer to race in the Masters category 
***Masters categories will be divided into 35+/45+/55+ categories for CASH awards IF the field size is greater than 20, but the state championship awards WILL be 35+/45+/55+ regardless of field size***
directions: FROM MAIN STREET IN BILLINGS HEIGHTS: turn West on Wicks Lane.

title: Tour of Montana
description: Tour of Montana - Team Time Trail, Road Race & Criterium. Three one-day events all starting & finishing in Downtown Missoula. See www.TourofMontana.org for additional and the most current information or email info@tourofmontana.org
course:
TTT - 11 mi loop with several turns and 250 ' of climbing
RR - 9.2 mi loop, technical turns and 550' of climbing per lap
Criterium  - 1.3 mi flat circuit with 7 turns
registration: Please go to Bikereg.com for registration https://www.bikereg.com/tour-of-montana
notes:
TTT: Pro/1/2/3 W invitational, min 4 and max 6 riders, team entry fee
TTT: Pro/1/2 M invitational, min 4 and max 6 riders, team entry fee
TTT: ToMTTTChallenge (Amateur Challenge), min 4 and max 6 riders. All female, all male or mixed gender teams. Mixed gender teams of 4 or 5 riders must be comprised of two of the opposite gender. six-rider teams must be 3 + 3. Entry fee is per rider
Winners jerseys will be awarded for the following:
Invitational TTT (women & men race winning teams)
Road Race women & men: race winner, QOM/KOM winner, Sprint winner, U25 young rider
Criterium all categories: race winner, Pro/Elite women & men will also receive sprint and U25 young rider winners jerseys
Tour of Montana reserves the right to combine classes/categories based on participation numbers for Downtown Missoula/Hip Strip Criterium
Junior Criterium - Ages 10-14, 15/16 & 17/18 boys & girls will race together unless registration numbers exceed 15 per gender than separate events will be run
Kids races will take place after the Cat 1/2/3 Masters and before the Juniors
directions: All events start in Downtown Missoula, MT at S. Higgins Ave & Front St. Onsite registration & packet pick up in Caras Park

title: Billings Omnium Championship Weekend
description: The First Annual Billings Omnium Weekend (BOW) features the FIRST EVER Montana State Omnium Championship and also includes the return of the Hogback Classic State Championship
course:
The BOW starts early Saturday morning with the State Championship Road Race.  The staging area is Phipps park by 64th Street and Molt Road.  The course is the same as last year, a 28 mile loop.  Some categories will do the loop twice.

Saturday evening will have the Time Trial as a 15 mile OUT-and-BACK on DUCK CREEK ROAD.  The staging area will be the Fishing Access.

The Criterium is a benefit for the Downtown Billings Associations' Spare Change For Real Change fund to end homelessness. starting and finishing under Skypoint, this race features .7 mile laps with two 180 degree turns each! It's right in the heart of downtown, so there will be great spectator action for sure. Every race will have at least 2 preme laps.
registration: Register online at USACycling.org by 8/5 and the cost is only $30 per event.  After 8/5 the cost goes up to $40 per event.  Receive a $15 discount when you register for all three events in advance.
notes:
Races will be held RAIN or SHINE. 

JUNIORS AND KIDS RACE FREE. 

ROAD RACE & TIME TRIAL: these will be partially closed/open courses, but traffic will be controlled. 

CRITERIUM: closed course

Cash payouts are as follows: 
Pro/1/2/3 =75/50/25. 
Masters = 60/40/20. 
Cat 4/5 = 50/30/20. 
Citizens = 30/20/10 
***Womens cash payout will be dependent upon field size*** ***Cash payouts may be lowered if the registrations are not enough to cover the payout*** 
***Promoter reserves the right to combine and/or separate fields*** 

No refunds. 

Junior = Racers under 18 on race day. 
Kids = Racers under 10 on race day. 
Senior = Any racer over 18 years old. 
Master = Racers over 35 years old who prefer to race in the Masters category 
***Masters categories will be divided into 35+/45+/55+ categories for CASH awards IF the field size is greater than 20, but the state championship awards WILL be 35+/45+/55+ regardless of field size***

title: 2015 Missouri River Rampage Mountain Bike Race
Second Annual Road Race to Rapelje
description: The race begins on Rapelje Road at the cemetary. The 50 mile event is from the cemetery to Rapelje and back (finish at the starting line). The 25 mile event is a race halfway to Rapelje and back. The 10 mile event is a 5 mile out and 5 mile back race. The 60 mile race begins with an out and back to the Holmgren Fishing Access off of Highway 306, then goes to Rapelje and back. To get to the race: take I-90 to Columbus; follow MT-78 to Pike Avenue, turn right (west), Pike turns into HWY 10, continue to Rapelje Road.
course: The race begins at the on Rapelje Road at the cemetary.  The 50 mile event is from the cemetary to Rapleje and back (finish at the starting line).  The 25 mile event is a race TO Rapelje with a truck and trailer shuttle back to the start.  The 10 mile event is a 5 mile out and 5 mile back race.  The 60 mile race begins with an out and back to the Holmgren Fishing Access off of Highway 306.
registration: Register online at USACycling.org for only $30 if pre-registered by 8/26.  After 8/26 registration increases to $40.
notes:
Race will be held RAIN or SHINE. JUNIORS AND KIDS RACE FREE. This will be an open course, but traffic will be controlled at turnarounds and intersection.  ***Promoter reserves the right to combine and/or separate fields*** No refunds. Junior = Racers under 18 on race day. Kids = Racers under 10 on race day. Senior = Any racer over 18 years old. Master = Racers over 35 years old who prefer to race in the Masters category ***Masters categories will be divided into 35+/45+/55+ categories.
*we are not offering cash prizes at this event
directions: To get to the race: take I-90 to Columbus; follow MT- 78 to Pike Avenue, turn right (west), Pike turns into HWY 306, turn right on Rapelje Road.

title: Team Rockford Cyclocross series
description: The Team Rockford Cyclocross series is a weekly cyclocross training series for all abilities.
course: The course is an approximately 2 mile long,  European style circuit. We change the course every week and rarely race the same route twice in the series.
registration: Registration opens at 5 pm in the parking lot behind the Sunset Hills Cemetery Maintenance building. This building is located just south of the Lindley Center
notes: Series cost is $45 for all 9 races or $8 per race. This does include USAC licence fees.
directions: From main street in Bozeman, turn south onto Cypress Ave. then right onto Golf way. Registration will be behind the second building on the left.

title: 24 Hours of Flathead
description: A non-profit race to provide awareness and adaptive equipment to individuals living with paralysis and other life altering disabilities
course: Roughly a 10 mile course with a combination of single track and road trails
registration: Early registration pricing is from 3/16/2015 - 8/5/2015.  On 8/5/2015, registration price increases and it will increase one final time the day of the race.
notes: Winners are ranked top 3 in each category.  Every winner will receive a medal.
directions: 24 Hours of Flathead is located at Herron Park in Kalispell, MT.  https://plus.google.com/115746002801427229109/about?gl=us&hl=en

title: Bohart Bash 2015

address.street: Bohart Ranch, 16621 Bridger Canyon Road, Bozeman, MT

description: Bohart Bash Mountain Bike Race
course: Five mile, mostly singletrack lap.
registration: Register online by 10pm on September 10. The first pre-registered riders will receive a special prize.
notes: Race entry includes raffle, lunch, live music, and refreshments.
directions: Bohart Ranch - 16 miles north of Bozeman on Highway 86, just past Bridger Bowl.

title: Montana State Time Trial Championships
description: Montana Time Trial and Team Time Trial State Championships
course: The staging area is at Canyon Creek School on Duck Creek Road
registration:
$30 to pre-register, $40 after 9/16, $45 onsite.

Team Time Trial is $10 per rider to pre-register, $15 after 9/16/ and $20 onsite.
notes: Montana State Championship Event, USAC State Champ Medals will be awarded.
directions:
From Billings: get off I-90 at the Shiloh exit and head west on the frontage road; turn left on Duck Creek Road; Canyon Creek School is on your left.

From Bozeman: take the East Laurel exit and head east on the frontage road.  Turn right on Duck Creek Road.  The staging area is on your left.

title: Helena CX Fun Ride
description: The beginners and fun race is for those who what to try cyclocross in a less competitive setting or just want to go out and have fun.  We may even have a special fat bike category.  Three laps on a shortened course with sand, pump-track, and barriers.  Fun for young and old alike.
course: Three laps on a shortened cyclocross course.
registration: On-site registration the day of the event.

title: Bozeman Grand Prix
description: The BOZEMAN GRAND PRIX  is the premier cyclocross race in Bozeman, and is part of the WILD WEST SERIES. The race will have a total cash payout of $5000.00
course: The course is a challenging European style cross course with a mixture of single track, grass, gravel and pavement. Power grinding elevation change, tight switchbacks and unique obstacles will keep you on your toes.
registration: Pre -Register online or at the venue the morning of. Registration starts at 8:30am and goes until 10:30.
notes: * prize list not to exceed $1999 per category*
directions: From I-90, take exit 309. Off the exit head west on main st. and take left at first stop light, Highland Blvd. Head up Highland Blvd course will be in the open space/ field to your right. Parking will be in the softball field parking lot located off Ellis St. Ellis St. is the first left on Highland towards the end of the field the course is in. Ride west across Highland St. from the parking lot and your in the course. Registration is at the northwest corner of the course in the lindley Center.

title: Rolling Thunder
description: Rolling Thunder is celebrating it's 10th Anniversary.  It's a two day cyclocross event in Missoula, MT.  This year's racing will be at Big Sky Brewery.  We are proud to be part of the Wild West Series.
course: Saturday and Sunday courses will be 1.5 mile miles in length.  It's a mixed surface course with a long pavement start/finish, twisty irrigated grass sections, bumpy field sections, and gravel.  There will be a run up and sand pit.  Sunday's course will have some modifications but the start/finish will be the same.
registration: We highly encourage online registration.  To help promote this, we are willing to provide full refunds for anyone who can't show up last minute.  The only day of registration will be from 10am - 11:30am on Saturday and 7:45am - 8:30am on Sunday.  Racers will be allowed to check in for their race up until 30 minutes to the start.
notes: We are super excited to have you at Rolling Thunder.  There are always some special treats.  Big Sky Beer Garden, bouncy house, special course features, and lots more!  visit www.rollingthundercyclocross.com for full details, or visit the Facebook Page for the latest gossip.
directions: Use I90 exit 99 Airway Blvd.  Immediately turn right on Trumpeter Way.  You can't miss it.  You can see the brewery and course tape from I90.
